Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Nadeem N
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I travel to Dubai. I travel to Dubai for food and shisha and the Emirates towers is in the perfect location to offer you the best of both!

Reviews.Title: “What could you ask more ?”
Reviews.Author: Noumar
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay!! Thanks so much for all the staff of Emirates Tower. We stayed there for 5 nights and had a marvelous time. The hotel is great (very good restaurants, nice swimming pool, nice rooms with an amazing view, etc.) and the location is perfect as well. Indeed the metro is at 5min walk and there is a hotel shuttle to Dubai Mall, Jumeirah Beach, Mina Salam, etc. Certainly the hotel is more a business hotel...and so what? Everything is perfect for a "leisure" stay as well!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and superb facilities”
Reviews.Author: RonnieHongKong
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. We initially picked this hotel because the location is very close to a metro station, just 5-10 mins walk (though at the end we preferred to take a taxi as the taxi fare was quite reasonable in Dubai). We arrived at the hotel at around 7:30 am and were very impressed that we could immediately check-in which made us feel very comfortable, particularly after a 9 hours' flight! One excellent service was that the hotel provides hourly shuttle bus to Jumeirah Beach Hotel on one side and the Dubai Mall on the other side. Free access to Water Wadi and Jumeirah Beach Hotel facilities as well. Breaklfast was superb but the dinner at Wu at 51st /fl was only average.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular as usual”
Reviews.Author: KatieG75
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Stayed here several times: great service, great view, cosy rooms, lovely bed. Bathroom a bit too small, but I shown't complain! :) loved staying on the women's floor (40th) with luxury!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two classes of guests”
Reviews.Author: jgcbdsgte
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel with my wife and son for three nights on the way back to the UK after being in the Maldives for a week. Checking into this business hotel whilst in shorts (due to where we had travelled from) and with a 10 year old son in tow probably influenced the greeting we received as we had a problem at check in and felt we were dismissed by the gentleman on reception and also initally by the duty manager on the phone. The matter was resolved finally by the duty manager when i went back down to reception to talk to him but why it took this i still don't understand. On arriving in the room we found no bed for our son and had to request one. This arrived, was made up and left in the middle of the room! Now the last thing i want to be doing in the middle of the night is climbing over beds to get to the bathroom, a little thought would have saved me the effort of pushing a bed around a room, i didn't think that i was expected to do this in a three star hotel let alone a 5 star hotel and i certainly never had to do this previously in the JBH or the Mina a salem. We stayed at this hotel due to the fact that we wanted to be closer to the Dubai Mall and the airport but the benefit of this hotel is the fact you can still get access to the wild wadi and beaches via a free shuttle. However the free shuttle when we tried to use it was full. There was two groups still left but a car was quickly found to take one party and the one with the child (who were next in line) were ignored and told to take a taxi and get a receipt! The hotel is an excellent property and clearly caters for a business clientel but if forgets that sometimes other guests may wish to stay there too, particularly at weekends. As a family i would certainly choose either the JBH or the Mina before this hotel in the future as they cater for all types of guests. In the main though the staff are friendly and helpful (thanks to Rolando for helping arrange transport) and have responded to the comments i left on departing so there does appear to be a really concern as to guest experiences. I just feel slightly disappointed in that i believe had i been travelling on business and arrived in a suit, i would have had a different customer experience. Having read previous comments submitted, if there is any issues this hotel has, it seems that the majority are with check in staff (Hassan?) when not on business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeAndre W
Reviews.Content: My friends and i were visiting the hotel for a friends birthday. I was amazed by the staff in the hotel. We asked lots of questions, and amazingly all the staff knew their property well, which to me is a good start in staying in a very nice hotel. Travelling in most of the 5 star hotel, i have for once loved hospitality in the middle east, and the staff are too friendly and highly well mannered. The duty Manager at the hotel early morning during our check out was an amazing manager, he really bothered himself to make sure our departure was yet another arrival experience. The lady handling our check out was really sweet and a never ending smile, i forgot her name. I would definitely go back to this hotel. i felt spoilt.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ShallyWaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and clean on its own.Not as fab as the others like jumeirah beach hotel and co but you can their facilities as a guest here and they have a regular shuttle service for that.The decor in the rooms are very nice, and the staff are very helpful even with things outside their department. Its a business hotel but its still good even if you are not on a business trip, its a stone throw away from the burj khalifa, dubai mall(hotel has a free shuttle), dancing fountains and other cool places. The food is good and you can also have food delivered from most places in the dubai mall because it is close. I really liked the heated pool because the day I went swimming was windy and a bit chilly. Also, their cosmetics and toiletries are not cheap stuff but good stuff like molton brown and co.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant and Relaxed team”
Reviews.Author: Rawanrg
Reviews.Content: Different Quality, Different Team than other hotels in Dubai. Their Receptionists have a very nice personality.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel - I wish I could rate it higher”
Reviews.Author: onthepiste
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times on business and enjoyed it so much I came back on holiday. The service is fantastic, the hotel is so clean and modern. It is a business hotel in the main but if you want to hit the shops this hotel is very close to the Mall and not far away from all the other attractions. This hotel became my second home and the staff here would always be extremely helpful. The restaurant choice within the hotel is fantastic and caters for all. The pool and gym are more than adequate and never ever busy. I travel a lot with my job and I have never returned to a hotel for a holiday but it shows how exceptional this hotel this. This is by far the best business hotel I have stayed in and I wouldn't hesitate to come back for business or pleasure, it is miles ahead of any other hotel I have stayed in for this purpose and for this reason I wish I could rate it a lot higher. An excellent team and superbly managed.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in The financial district”
Reviews.Author: ilrich
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel situated on the Sheik Zayed Rd about a 15 minute drive from the airport. Fantastic views of the surrounding city vista and desert. Small functional swimming pool on the ground floor but you can get a free ride to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, use all the facilities there and just charge everything to your room. Service throughout the hotel is excellent and make sure you visit Vu, the fabulous restaurant on the top floor for a gourmet experience at very reasonable prices. The lobby has a wine bar and afternoon tea facility. You can also walk through to the Emirates Towers Boulevard where you can find upscale shopping and more restaurants, including a branch of The Ivy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for buisness trip”
Reviews.Author: elmadanat1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights to attend a medical meeting , my wife as usual was with me , i think this hotel is excellent , the staff were very helpful , rooms clean and well supplied , breakfast rich though the same food was served everyday . if youare in buisness trip to Dubai i definitely recommend this hotel , for Family and kids i will choose a hotel in JBR area .

Reviews.Title: “A distinctive hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Khaled7691
Reviews.Content: My second time to stay at this location with 8 years apart. The property, furniture, appliances still looked as new as ever, how do they do that. The service was good, the free wifi helped keep me in touch with my work back home. The only not so good experience is the gentleman in the check in desk, I think he was Egyptian, he was not polite and not helpful. Otherwise my experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelvalIreland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times. It is excellent for the business traveller. staff excellent they anticipate your every need. my only complaint is the restaurants. each time I return a favourite has closed and a new one opened, and not always as good as the previous one. lack of hotel shop, it closed recently! less formal restaurant badly needed as a woman travelling alone,this hotel is excellent. excellent pool area and spa

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - a great choice in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Emirates Towers hotel for two nights in February 2012. I arrived in Dubai at 5am, after an extended trip from Australia via Korea. I was fed up with travelling and was desperate for a shower and a lie down. Without a huge amount of confidence, I requested an early check in and was not surprised that there was no room immediately available. What was very impressive, however, was how staff at the front desk responded from there. My bags were whisked away and I was taken straight through to the very nice Moasici restaurant. A newspaper was put in front of me and I was invited to enjoy a free breakfast buffet while they sorted a room for me. By the time I'd worked my way through a plate of the best pastries I've ever tried outside of France, my room was ready and my bag had been taken upstairs. THAT'S the kind of service that makes you feel welcome, and it's an example of all of my interactions with staff over the course of my visit. My room was large, and well fitted out. A great little bonus was a coffee machine in the room, with my jetlag chased away with vast amounts of espresso. Toiletries and all the little extras in the room were wonderful quality and made for a very comfortable experience. Internet was Wifi (available for free throughout the hotel) and very fast. If you have a few moments during your trip, don't miss the gym/health club. It is equal to any that I've come across in hotels around the world, and again the service is excellent. Although I didn't swim, the pool looked very good, too. There are a number of restaurants on site, which are pricey but very high quality. Overall, I can't fault this hotel. It's high quality fit out is supported with a wonderful level of friendly, professional service that made it feel like home. Emirates Towers is a great choice for your stay in Dubai and I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property in the heart of the business district”
Reviews.Author: Mumbaiya41
Reviews.Content: We were given one of the newly renovated rooms facing the Burj Khalifa. Excellent view of the business centre. Very convenient location - just 5 mins by taxi to the Dubai Mall. Tube station just a 2-3 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Max_scot1976
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near both the financial centre and the Dubai Mall. Good location for shopping and for food and free transport from the hotel to and from the mall. Welcomed with excellent service from arrival to departure. Lovely large rooms with wonderful bathrooms, good pool and spa facilities and highly professional and friendly staff. Overall the experience was excellent and I would happily return to the same hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Business or Leisure - a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumansil
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights during ARAB health conference. I had a room on 30th florr with fantastic view of the city. COnventions centre approx 1 km away. Rooms are spacious with good amenities. Service is good.Wifi was perfect for your business need. I did not have to utilise the other facilities like pool, spa, gym or lounge due to my busy schedule. staffs are friendly and effecient....only what I missed the complementary Fruit busket - although I complaint during my stay but still not delivered - do not know the reason :(. Rest all my experience is good. But remember this hotel is expensive with valued added services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jinw4672rx
Reviews.Content: This hotel takes service to another level. The staff is always very polite and eager to help. I asked a staff walking by in the lobby about shoe shine (after my desert experience in dress shoes, I know... brilliant) and he followed me to my room and took my shoes and dropped it off in 15 mins looking like the day I bought it. I have never been to a place where people just takes charge and own the situation and deliver. The quality of sleep is very nice and the rooms are well planned out that provides ample space. The internet is fast enough but could be a little faster. The breakfast is wonderful and the location is convenient but the jewel is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt fault it! 5* at its best!”
Reviews.Author: BooPerkins
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we couldn't fault our stay here. Even though we arrived early in the morning the staff did their best to get us checked into our rooms before the 1500 check in time! Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff were really friendly. We travelled as a family and found that although this is primarily a business hotel it was also very good for families and couples alike. The added extras like the transport to Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Wild Wadi were a bonus. I was extremely impressed by the Molton Brown products in the enormous bathroom! The breakfast was superb and we would recommend booking on a bed and breakfast rate if you can as it saves quite a lot of money. Would definitely recommend this hotel any day of the week. I really hope we are lucky enough to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: evaogriseg
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, beautiful furniture, spacious bathroom with bathtub and separate shower, free shuttle to the beach, close to DIFC with many possibilities for a night out, friendly staff, impressive lobby with glass elevators (not for people with fear of heights). The best thing about this hotel is its breakfast: it is the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen in a hotel, such a wide choice that it will not leave anyone unsatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Guest of the Emirati”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: Hi ALL, I was lucky enough to win a trip to Dubai last year as a guest of Emirates Airlines. They put us up in the Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel which was a lovely facility. Great for business travellers. The location was perfect, right in the middle of the business district and the views from the hotel fabulous. The room was large and had a small work space and large bathroom with all the normal amenities. The other hotel facilities, pool and restaurants were well staff and convienently located in the property. I would recommend this to any business traveller, travelling to the UAE.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star at its best.”
Reviews.Author: Cocolino_12
Reviews.Content: You dont need to take an expensive Hotel at Jumeirah Beach if you can stay in the Emirates Towers. You have all what you want. Free Shuttle to the Jumeirah Beach no traffic jam if you want to go for shopping or to the old city. With staying in Emitates Towers you have real 5 star hotel and your money you can spend for shopping instead for an overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best service”
Reviews.Author: odnobro
Reviews.Content: my wife and I are very pleased great lifts a very good number on 33 floor beautiful view from the window friendly staff good restaurants in the hotel free entrance to Wild Wadi AqvaPark free entrance to the beach Jumeirah Beach Hotel near Burj Al Arab Hotel the best service that we have seen

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: alexm984
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at this hotel, we had the most amazing suite ever, everyone made my children really welcome, we now live in Dubai and every time we drive past it brings back a good Christmas day

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Reception”
Reviews.Author: imran a
Reviews.Content: secoind visit in 1 year, all changed in 12 months. very cold welcome to hotel. left to 1 side whilst waiting for room to be ready which was 45 minutes late and reason given was we are very busy! If you get the back side of the tower expect to horriable views and no sun so looks very dull allday. New refurbished rooms now more like an office then a retreat. No fruit anymore with room service and cut backs on the toliteries looks like this is thier new approuch and is going to stay like this. would not recommend and will not be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant @ its place”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian-Advisor
Reviews.Content: Nice, elegant, expensive as Dubai but its deserves. Its a more of a business and comfortable classy place away from the commercial crowded hotels. Many nice restaurants options inside and in the shopping area just 2 minutes access from the hotel. the beauty is the view from the building itself as if are lucky taking a nice room you can have a view of all Dubai. Easy access almost to everything as its very close to the airport, Dubai mall around the corner. enjoy:)

Reviews.Title: “No care at all”
Reviews.Author: JLM235
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my best friend at Jumeirah Emirates Towers. Honestly the room we were given was very nice, on the executive floor with an amazing room. The amenities are very nice as well. As with much in Dubai, it was extremely overpriced but still nice. I gave it a terrible rating because on one of the days the room cleaners accidentally took some very sentimental personal property along with our bedding. We immediately notified the management who wouldn't even come to meet us. They kept saying they were looking for our items which were never found. They must have been stolen or trashed. They were completely unapologetic. If you decide to stay here lock EVERYTHING up that you don't want to disappear and if it does, do not expect anything from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Emirates Hotel Dubai - A business experience”
Reviews.Author: SS13London
Reviews.Content: A Towering twin building away from the main city but very well located for access to major locations in Dubai, is an exciting setting for the business traveller. Impressive foyer with a constant buzz all day long. Excellent meeting and entertaining facilities. The various open plan seating at different levels was a pleasant addition as was the top floor guests quality Menu. Spacious rooms with all expected 5* facilities and amazing views accross Dubai and the top room service, surprisingly prompt for the size of the Hotel. All technical gadets and yet a splendid gracious warm comfort was felt too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay”
Reviews.Author: CarloBrussels
Reviews.Content: Have recently stayed at this hotel on a leisure trip with family (2 kids 4 and 7 years old). We simply loved it. Everybody was professional and had a smile on their face, I am really impressed. Service was outstanding. We had contacted hotel beforehand to warn them we would arrive at 7am and they let us check in immediately despite the hotel was nearly full. I appreciated the fact that the duty manager returned my call almost immedately after I called the reception, something unusual espcially for a business-oriented hotel dealing with large group-bookings rather than families. Food was also a pleasant surprise. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant Il Mosaico and there was plenty of choice and freshly made food. Al Nafoorah served excellent Libian food for a reasonable price, I learned it's got a good reputation also with the royal family and I can imagine why. We also tried the Tokyo/Et Sushi, again excellent food and the ambience was very pleasant. Try to book the live cooking show, where you seat and eat right beside the cook, kids and adults love it! If you do not have breakfast in your package, there is Starbucks in the mall adjacent to the hotel, excellent breakfast for European prices. Leisure - We took fool advantage of the complimentary access to Wild Wadi park and the other hotels of Jumeirah Chain, and the possibility to change hotel gives you great variety and the best of both worlds. Shuttle ride lasted about 30 minutes, but the driver was always on time and it went very smoothly. Also the swimmingpool of the hotel and the jacuzzi outdoor are beautiful, we were regular guests after dusk. The health club at the hotel was also very good, and the shower and changing facilities were simply amazing. The rooms were quite large with a breathtaking view from our high floor. Everything was spotless and cleaning personnel came by several times to ask whether we needed something. I did not use the business facilities because it was leisure but the concierge and the staff had to deal with a number of requests as hotel was folly booked due to a conference nearby and they seemed very professional and caring. All in all I can only recommend this hotel as everything has been impeccable, even compared to other 5-star hotels where we have stayed in Dubai (see separate reviews). We will certainly go back to the JET on our next trip to Dubai, thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive But Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Hawker-Eye
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Earlier this year, booze very expensive but if you want a deal go to the pub in the shopping area under the hotel. Buy one get one free. For a really special experience go to the roof bar what a view and good drinks but ££££. Breakfast is really good with lots of choice. Pool and gym are really good. Shower products lovely but geared for Men not Ladies. Great for me not so good for the Lady. Really comfy large bed and great kit in the room. All in all top hotel Would I recommend it YES sir Yes Oh and if you have time you can get into to Wild Widi for free and there is a free bus to it from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: gdl_traveler1
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great breakfast buffet, (just expect no pork food.) Comfortable rooms, several restaurants to choose for dinner, great gym facilities, an for a drink, head to the sky bar. Excellent choice in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: kaizerStyria
Reviews.Content: my wife and me stayed there from October 26th to October 29th during a stop over. as a seasoned busness traveller I rate this as one of the better hotels I have stayed in. the hotel, the rooms are great, the location is very good and the service is just outstanding. The value for money compared to European hotels on this level is outstanding as well. The only advise we can give is that the limosine service offered is not really necerarry as there are ample taxis available at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “JUST GETS BETTER”
Reviews.Author: GOODHANDBAG
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and just keeps getting better. The rooms have just recently had an update and they are very tastefully done. The rooms are always so very quiet and very well equiped. This is mainly a business hotel but dont be put off as you get access to the Madinat Jumirah (on the beach). The staff at the Emirates Towers are wonderful and so helpful, the hotel runs so smoothly and I always feel so welcome. I have now been 7 times to this hotel and cannot recommend it more highly. The breakfast is excellent too, everything has been thought of - I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hemachandran
Reviews.Content: I was in Dubai last February during the Microsoft Tech Ed and I stayed in Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel. I choose this one since it was very near to the convention centre. But there were no chance to regret. It was a nice hotel very with spacious and clean rooms. I will say its optimal for a business trip for holiday trip i would recommend to choose a beach hotel if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Club floor good, not great”
Reviews.Author: auzzieboy_10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 5 nights on the club floor. The room was large, with a separate living area so didn't feel claustrophobic. Even though the room was billed as recently refurbished there were signs of wear and tear on the carpet and wall paper. Bathroom was spotlessly clean and huge shower. It was a busy period at the hotel, couldn't get near the tiny pool for families with kids so decamped to Madinat Jumeirah using the free beach pass from concierge. Didn't use the (offered) bus service just took a cab. Negative points - the staff in the club floor were a little less than warm and friendly, a bit distant. Compare to the Ritz Carlton club floor in dubai , where the hosts are charming, friendly and really welcoming. I think the Jumeirah team should visit to get some tips! Be warned - if you are not dressed in a suit at all times you get some rather pitying looks from some staff members. Very good rate via ebookers otherwise It would have been overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vitzi
Reviews.Content: I stay here on various business trips and enjoyed my stay. The hotel is located near the Trade Center area and it caters a a mix of business and holiday traveller. While it is not on the beach, you get free beach passes and shuttle bus to Jumeirah Beach hotel, next to the Burj al Arab (~30 min ride). There is also a free shuttle bus to Dubai Mall (~10min ride). The rooms are modern and spacious. There are several restaurants in the hotel and various others on the mall attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: gil72
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel, during a business trip in Dubai for the IBA Conference. I had the chance to pay a visit in many of the hotels in Dubai, but Emirates Tower seems to be one of the best hotel for a business trip. It's new, with large room and in a very good position. There is a good choice of restaurant and a bar at the 51st floor with a fantastic view. Nothing to say about the services: everything is faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toomdc
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel in Dubai. I was there for a conference and could not be happier. (It was my second stay at the Towers). The rooms are large and well appointed with fabulous views of the Dubai skyline. They provide shuttle service to their beach properties and free beach access. The hotel itself is conveniently located within walking distance (even by Dubai standards) of the DIFC. It was a short cab ride to the convention center. The staff could not be nicer or more helpful. The hotel has free internet access (which has to be the business standard in the 21st century). My one quibble is the cost of services at the business center. Even a very modest amount of printing mounted up quite quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! For it's world class emergency services in addition to everything else”
Reviews.Author: Thsamih
Reviews.Content: Family with kids staying 5 nights, 2 rooms! I can't find words to describe what happened to me and my family. We are in Dubai for a 5 day vacation, my 2 years old gets a cold and develops respiratory problems! The hotel went out of it's way to make my stay comfortable & gave my family comfort. Many names I want to recognize for going the extra mile. I am still half way into my stay, however, didn't want to wait to write my review. As I am really thankful! The jumeriah towers has a max 4 minutes wait for 911 services to arrive in hotel. Not to mention their own in house emergency services. The rooms r great, nice views, many dinning options, a short distance to all attractions and free access to wild wadi and all the jumeirah beaches. Friendly staff, really caring! I will always make this my first choice in Dubai, For family with children that cares about the safety and well being of their kids, jumeriah hotels are your best option, The towers are great for business, and also, if u have kids, they will be happy too. Thank you again, and keep up your great work!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Latimer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Dubai,all of the Jumeirah properties in Dubai and London and was looking forward to my first trip to Emirates Towers. Unfortunately, the whole experience was spolied within the first 45 minutes by the attitutude of the staff member that checked us in and the fact that the hotel room allocated to us was not suitable for two adults and a child of 9. Note to staff - offering a pillow and a blanket for my child to sleep on the couch in the room is not acceptable. We were clearly allocated a room suitable for one business person - i.e one tooth mug, one bathrobe etc I booked with my plantinum Amex, which normally ensures a room upgrade - was told there were none available without the system even being checked and when I challenged this (because I had checked on my way there) I was told that it was not possible because they had 'important guests staying' Funny, I thought Jumeirah considered that all of its guests were important, especialy Sirius card holders. The card also grants 4pm check out and after the check in team member questioned my status and read the whole email (all 4 pages whilst stood in front of me) again I was told this was not possible. It was the only reason I booked as we had an 8pm flight time home. So we all trouped back down to reception I asked to speak to a manager and was told 'he's busy' - again this one done without checking. I asked about cancellation policy so that we could check out the next day and got into a debate were the check in clerk refused to tell me the hotel's policy and insisted I pay for the whole stay or spoke to American Express at my own expense. My son was in tears by the time we eventually got to the room with our luggage and of course we were late for a dinner reservation that had to be cancelled. I spoke to Amex who phoned the duty manager. A bed eventually arrived in the room for my son, we had to climb over it to get to the bathroom. The duty manager agreed a 4pm check out the next day and we left - never to return. I was left feeling like we should really have used the tradesman's entrance. This is a lovely hotel and very well situated in Dubai, especially if you are on business. There is a metro station close by and so other areas are easily accessible. I am sure it has many satisfied guests - it just wasn't for us. The free access to Wild Wadi and Madinat Jumeirah is excellent and the conceirge very helpful in organising waht was to be our only day in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: Subsea-1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and could not fault a single thing. Was part of a group of nine and we were all delighted with the hotel. Everyone was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An evergreen luxury business destination in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: marco_and_nadine
Reviews.Content: Although not one of the most recent hotels built in booming Dubai, Emirates Towers remains one remarkable destination for business travellers. Once THE destination for business, it might have been now somehow surpassed by some of the newest and much talked about hotels that have been recently inaugurated, but without doubts it keeps its unmistakable classy touch. On the positive sides: very large rooms, astonishing views over Dubai thanks to the full glass wall that never fails to impress you once entering your room, large and clean bathrooms, excellent and very rich breakfast buffet, very good gym, personnel extremely polite and helpful. Taking the high speed glass elevator is always an amazing experience, with the view over Shaik Zayed Road that suddenly disappears once the elevator reaches the mezzanine. Sipping a cocktail at Vu bar on the top of the hotel is another experience you don't want to miss. Just a small little annoying detail (but really minor) is the noise of the elevator that you can hear, especially in the silence of the night, in some of the rooms close to the elevators. I have been staying in Emirates Towers many times over the years, and I would surely recommend it for business travellers that want to enjoy their free time and that want to impress their business acquaintances. However I would not recommend it so strongly for leisure travellers, as Dubai has alternative destinations more focussed on them: here the pool is nice but clearly made for a quick dip rather than for sun addicts wanting to spend the whole day there. Although there is an efficient shuttle service that connects to the Jumeirah beaches, still you have to spend 15 to 30 minute in it before reaching the beach, depending on the traffic. The hotel is actually quite close to one of the metro stations, but it is a little bit challenging to reach it by walking (10 to 15 minutes fast walking), especially considering the heat that you have in Dubai for 10 months a year, so you may prefer the usual taxi solution for moving in the city. All in all, as said, I would strongly recommend the Emirates Towers for all business travellers. Less so for leisure travellers that intend to spend time at the beach and/or move back and forth from the hotel to the typical city destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, luxurious and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: RishiDhuper
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and I must say that it was a memorable experience. Room was almost 500 sqft overlooking DIFC and burj khalifa Multiple eating options within the hotel Staff at concierge was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but aging round the edges”
Reviews.Author: William_N
Reviews.Content: Location: about ten or fifteen minutes away from the airport (assuming there's no traffic) and not too far away from the DIFC. Check-in: quick and efficient. Room: the room had a slightly odd smell on entry, but something which one ceases to notice after a couple of minutes. Bathroom amenities are nice "old school" Molton Brown ones, rather than the ubiquitous L'Occitanes that seem to have permeated many other hotel chains. Service: good room service as well as at the wine bar on the ground floor, but unfortunately the lobby lounge service needs some polish and a smile. Check-out: efficient; for guests who have a late flight out, they will direct you to the gym changing room if you want to change out of your business suit to something more casual.

Reviews.Title: “Head and shoulders above the rest (in the GCC!!)”
Reviews.Author: Paisa_on_the_go
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in good, bad and downright ugly hotels in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Kuwait. After more than 10 stays, JET is without a doubt the best business hotel in the whole region. Awesome and efficient service without being pompous, stiff or arrogant. If you are coming on holiday to Dubai this place might not be for you. However, if you are coming on business (particularly to DIFC) and need a place that works like a swiss clock, this is your place. It is not a trendy hotel and it doesn’t have a lot of buzz, but the service is just awesome. I put them to the test this time (not by choice) and I have concluded that in addition to being hoteliers they are pretty good fire fighters!.If something is going to go wrong this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buisness Hotel in the Middle East”
Reviews.Author: CanadianThunders
Reviews.Content: Forget about the ultra modern design, which in a city like Dubai is a dime a dozen. What really differentiates the Emirates Towers is the courtesy and knowledge of its staff, ease and smoothness of check in, attention to detail, promptness in response, continuous upgrades of rooms, free WiFi, and the wide array of amneties and F&B venues available. I have been staying there for the past 11 years, and nothing even comes close.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant...”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: Checked in here for 2 nights, my first Jumeirah experience. Room was big, luxurious with every amenity you could ever think of. Coffee machine included (nespresso). Bathrooms were huge and clean Staff was very friendly and gladly explained the features of the room. I chose the Jumeirah chain because we could get free access to wild wadi. Fitness center was very well equipped. Pool rather small but good enough. Room service options were fantastic and food tasted great. A little bit pricy What was disappointing was the Iftar dinner that came with our package (ramadan package). We were not told that we had to make 'reservations' with the restaurant. When we went to the restaurant we were told that it was fully booked. Unhappy and hungry, we approached the front desk for rectification and clarification. The front desk was only staffed with 1 person! There was a queue of like 3 people in front of us waiting. We waited for a good 20mins before the front staff could attend to us! Lots of phone calls to and fro, we were finally seated in the restaurant at 8:30pm for our IFTAR dinner. Overall an OK experience, would love to try other hotels when I visit Dubai next.

Reviews.Title: “These are really towers”
Reviews.Author: Khalid78
Reviews.Content: Jumeirah Emirates Towers is considered a nice hotel as one tower is the hotel and the other tower is the offices, nice lobby, shops are there down in this hotel, rooms are excellent but the price is slightly expensive, I would recommend it for business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Taran B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 2 young children aged 8 & 3, I have been to Dubai on several ocassion's and stayed at some of the best hotels in the Jumierah Beach area, I wanted to give this a go as this included private acess to Jumeriah Beach/Madinat Jumeriah and also the Wild Wadi park, I was worried at first but this was one of best holidays ever! we all had an excellent time the staff were great and the shuttle bus's are quite frequent to the malls and hotels, the only slight downside was I mentioned to them it was our 10 year wedding anniversary prior to us coming but there was not a mention we stayed at the Grosvenor for 7 nights after our stay here and they upgarded to a suite and also gave us a nice bottle of wine and cholocates which was a really thoughfull thing to do! but hey I cant complain we will stay here again in futre we were really impressed hpe to see you again next easter! :)

Reviews.Title: “easily one of the best hotels i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: samirgoenka
Reviews.Content: i was overwhelmed by the view from my 46th floor club exec suite to say the least. World class and the best of any class hotels. Beautiful rooms, awesome view,great pool and seevcice. The club lounge on the 42nd floor is awesomw and the pool is great too. The service left me with mixed feelings on the one hand the receptionist and the concierge were so friendly and helpful on the other hand some were outright rude and obnoxious ewve?? All -in all a great expeeriwence

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dull”
Reviews.Author: Manly-sider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. The hotel is centrally located in the downtown district and is 20 mins by cab from just about everywhere including the airport. The surrounding area is primarily office buildings so you need a cab if you want to eat outside of the hotel. The hotel does have a small shopping mall attached hosting top end stores and a few restaurants including The Ivy (nice food but feels like you're eating in the mall). The hotel is huge - 50 floors. The rooms are large and the decor somewhat eclectic (black granite everywhere, gold and purple carpets and hideous artwork). It looks smart but ugly at the same time. Staff are very helpful particularly at the concierge desk. The rooms are well equipped and the bathrooms have a huge shower and bath. There is a desk to work at and complimentary internet included. The AC unit is very noisy and had to be switched off at night to sleep. The hotel restaurant "Rib Room" is extortionate with 200g Australian steaks costing AED300 (approx. USD$82 in August 2011). I didn't eat there so couldn't comment on whether it was worth it. The attached hotel bar is cosy with a good wine selection but is very very smoky and the non-smoking area has just 3 seats. Several other bars in the hotel were closed for Ramadan. Overall the hotel is nice, is conveniently located but just very dull. It's isolated in the business district and the in-house dining options are over-priced. I usually stay at the Intercontinental Dubai Festival City and that's where I'll be returning - it is a far superior hotel and has a lot more character.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: NeseBek
Reviews.Content: Top notch from top to bottom inside the rooms. The restaurants provide great service and above average dining. Location provides great access to DIFC and Sheikh Al Zayed Road. The only thing I would not recommend is the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magnificient”
Reviews.Author: love_travel8487
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights while on our way for our honeymoon. It was just spectaculor. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The staff is very friendly and always remember you by your name. The experience was very personalised. Great atmosphere and great variety of restraunts and shopping around. It is located very close to the metro station and is centrallly located. If you looking for something out of the box and affordable , This is it.

Reviews.Title: “so tall i could faint”
Reviews.Author: zahidahmed
Reviews.Content: this was the best hotel i could ever bee my god so tall and luxorious you could access through metro and bus you could see the whol sheikh zayed road andvery comfortable rooms were very spacious bathroom had spa and room had free wifi internet access.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything especially the workers”
Reviews.Author: farahSA
Reviews.Content: location was great, shuttles every hour to Dubai mall, every two hours to wild wadi and the beach, free entrance to wild wadi. everything was great. amazing facilities, amazing workers, I liked every moment, the only problem is that it's really expensive, don't eat or drink there if you're not prepared to be pay a serious money.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahg83
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. It's luxuriously furnished, lobby is amazing, rooms are spacious, the facilities are well serviced. The staff were also very friendly. Make sure to get your free passes to Jumeirah beach and wild wadi.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Jumeirah service”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here before a flight from dubai strictly because I knew emirates towers would get us there on time. From the moment you drive up to the door they take care of you. Bags Taken to room, connecting rooms no problem, room service fast and good for dinner, breakfast buffet beautiful and first class. I hadn't stayed there for many years and I was so surprised the rooms were as new and clean as when the hotel first opened. Bathroom is immaculate and rooms spacious. For a trip in which I had so many things to take care of it was nice to know Jumeirah took care of uis.

Reviews.Title: “The Last Word In Luxuary”
Reviews.Author: kiwifarmer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on my way home from the UK and had booked a club room. On check in I was told that my reservation had been cancelled. Which was strange as I had received a confirmation text only the day before. It took quite a while to sort out, the booking having been mistakenly cancelled by the hotel. They were extremely apologetic, and I was personally shown to my room. On opening the door I was stunned, I had been upgraded to a suite by way of an apology for the mix up. It was the last word in luxury. Everything of the absolute best quality and ever little detail thought of. It had a hall, lounge, dinning area, cloakroom, bathroom with staggering views while lying in the bath, and the most comfortable bed room I think I have ever been in. This hotel is pure 5 star through and through and everything you would expect in a world class 5 star hotel. The staff were a model of efficiency, nothing is to much trouble. The executive lounge was excellent, I am sorry that my stay was not longer. This is a hotel that could not fail to impress, Its location does not make it a place ideal for families but it does provide transport to the beach and the shopping malls, and it was easy to get around.The metro only a short five minute walk away, but beware the heat!! I will certainly visit Dubai again and stay here with out doubt

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic business hotel...does what it is supposed to do”
Reviews.Author: salukionholiday
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel to dubai every 2-3 weeks and have become a big fan of JET. It is very convenient if you have meetings in the DIFC (financial district). Generally, I find the standard of rooms in Dubai to be as high as it comes globally, so the bar is high. The JET is not new by Dubai standards but it is very well thought out and got everything you need. The rooms are large and functional with a desk, good bed and large bathroom. There is a large gym downstairs and an even larger one in the mall below. If you are a regular visitor one of the advantages is the variety of restaurants in the Towers complex....from the Rib Room, to sushi to the best Lebanese in Dubai, the list goes on. The service is good and the location is a short walk to the DIFC. If you are looking for a business hotel in the financial district you cant do better.

Reviews.Title: “You pay reasonably and get a lot in return - best value for money in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: BirjuJani
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel for a few nights stay. emirates towers hotel has a clean & modern contemporary look. not as lavish as some other places in dubai - but definately has enough to still make you feel pampered. the price is more competitive than almost all the other 5 star hotels in dubai & there are always deals available which you can take advantage of. the hotel is owned by the jumeirah group (belongs to the sheikh). so it always keeps to a good standard. the group also owns a lot of other properties - which the hotel sometimes gives as complimentary. like the wild wadi water park which is usually AED 90 person (USD 25) is free entry for hotel guest. the deluxe room is a generous size with good amenities (espresso machine, flat screen TV, good bath products, turndown service with chocolates :) complimentary fuites & dates). i had my 6 month old baby with me - they provided a nice cot. very comfortable bed. there is also a long sofa that extends through the length of the room. i haven't seen this anywhere else. it comes in quite handy and makes the room more cosy. staff are efficient and on top of things. you have a very nice unobstructed view of nad al sheba from the room - which is one of the very few vast amounts of greenery you will see in dubai. the hotel is located on S.Z road & it's also smack in the middle of old & new dubai making it easy to commute around dubai efficiently - most places in 20 mins max. it also has a small mall connected on the ground floor with a starbucks and some designer stores which is convenient if you want to avoid the traffic, rush & heat. the only negatives are; it does have a businessy feel to it which may eat into some of the glamour holidaymakers may expect from dubai. the way the hotel is constructed you have to go by car to get anywhere because it's difficult to walk to the nearby metro station / DIFC; which are pleasently very close and useful. and in temperatures that can seriously reach 50 degrees celcius you wouldn't want to walk around anyway. if you can only take so much of flashy & gaudiness and you're looking for a good deal - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Made Even Better by The Free Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: ModelWorx
Reviews.Content: A colleague and myself stayed in the Emirates Towers during an overnight stay in Dubai when travelling from Kuala Lumpur to Manchester and couldnt help but be impressed by the service and decor of both the exteriour and interior. I was pleasently supprised to find that we'd been complimentary upgraded to a suite which was just fantastic, spacious bathroom with seperate WC, luxurious living area with fresh fruit, Nespresso machine, computer desk, LCD TV, and more. The bedroom, WOW! luxurious king size bed and 180 degree view over tower 2 and downtown Dubai, clearly seeing the Burj Khalifa in the distance

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: FleurdeLys2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Emirates Towers a couple of times - but the best times were when I was allocated a room in the dedicated "Chopard" ladies business travelers floor. Pink fluffy towels and pink bedlinen, perfume on your pillow for the turndown service and a complimentary yoga mat and DVD. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel amazing service. Great breakfast. Loved it absolutely.”
Reviews.Author: Anisha2608
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect about the hotel. From room service to dining to general maintenance. Loved it. No need to think twice before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, but not very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: DubDubDub
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from the list of "Dubai stopovers" recommended by Emirates when I booked our tickets to and from Europe, and it turned out to be one of the finest hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. Opulent and stylish, the service was beyond reproach, and the quality of the amenities was generally great. I would have no hesitation in staying here again if I was travelling to Dubai on business, but, if I was just looking for a place to unwind between flights I would definitely choose somewhere more relaxed. Jumeirah Emirates Towers is full of people doing business - from the always busy lobby bar to the fine dining restaurants, the adjoining office towers and shops, and the man in the Armani suit on the 30th floor finalising a deal on his mobile phone, the hotel exudes the "busy people doing important things" atmosphere that attracts high-flyers in droves. If, however, you're just stopping over between flights and want to be able to relax and walk around in your not-quite-Armani holiday clothes, you might, as we did, feel a bit under-dressed in this establishment. Check in was well handled when we arrived at 7 am (well before the 2:00 pm check in time). Not only did they manage to find us a room, but we were also given a refreshing fruit drink - just one of the finer touches offered by this hotel. Our room, on the 30th floor, was enormous compared to most of the places we had stayed in Europe, and slightly bigger than the other Dubai hotel we have stayed in. If the haze had cleared it would have also had a great view. A wide range of amenities came with the room including a Nespresso machine, a tv bigger than the one we have at home, a huge and very comfortable bed, and a bathroom that was big enough to throw a party in, should you be so inclined. Surprisingly, the quality of the bathroom fit-out was let down by the extremely slow drain rate of the shower and the vanity. While the shower did not overflow, I spent most of my shower standing in water over my toes, and when I brushed my teeth it took over a minute for the vanity to drain. When you're ready to eat, a selection of restaurants are available within the hotel and the adjoining "Boulevard". Luckily, the hotel guidebook lists the dress code for each of these restaurants, so you'll immediately know whether or not your clothes will get you into your restaurant of choice. We chose the casual dress code "ET Sushi" for lunch, which turned out to be so good we went back there for dinner. Highly recommended. In the afternoon we went out on an Arabian Adventures tour, and when we returned someone had visited the room and turned down the bed. Complimentary chocolates were on the pillows, slippers next to the bed, and a bucket of ice was on the coffee table. Another nice and unexpected touch. Interestingly, we noticed that while you can switch on the electronic "do not disturb" sign while you are in the room, it goes out as soon as you remove your room card, and there does not appear to be a way to enable it while you are out. We're used to being able to place a "do not disturb" card on the door if we don't want anyone visiting our room while we're out, and it was surprising that this facility is not available here. After a great sleep we managed to fit in a quick visit to the included buffet breakfast before we had to leave for our next flight. What a delight. It was one of the best breakfasts of our entire holiday. Melt-in-the-mouth pastries, very fresh fruit, decent coffee, and a wide range of other foods we would have loved to sample if we'd had the time. If you do decide to book into this hotel, make sure you include breakfast. Check out as just as smooth as check in, and the doormen went out of their way to make sure our transport to the airport (pre-booked through Emirates) was on the way when they didn't arrive at the scheduled time. This is a fine hotel, with great staff and opulent surroundings, but it's got a rushed feel to it. If you're a business person on a schedule, you'll feel right at home here, but if you're looking for somewhere to dress down and relax while "stopping over", there are better choices in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Fantastic hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: imran_rahman
Reviews.Content: First class in everything. Lovely lobby, lovely staffs, great food, excellent room, awesome bed, good bathroom. Everything is superb. Stay here if you plan a trip to Dubai, specifically the Sheikh Zayed Road area. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not the great "Jumeirah" experience :(”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi_Meghdadi
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal customer of the hotel for over 8-9 years, for my guests, groups and banqueting. I booked a VIP guest and his wife as always did when I wanted to be sure "nothing goes wrong". It's no exaggeration as nothing would even go wrong at JET before. The check-in was long (for which they later apologized to the guest) and this wasn't the worst part. I accompanied the guest to his room and to my surprise I really missed the flawless perfectionist JET rooms. This used to be be always the best in town and now due to - whatever reason - even the carpets look dirty, the furniture old and tired and compared to the newcomer hotels in Dubai, sorry to say, but it looks like a 4 star. My guest did not bother of course but to me this was a true disappointment as this hotel used to be home to me for years. We had our guests stay there, eat in the restaurants few times a week for business and almost all our meetings took place in the quiet and peaceful 10th floor lobby (cigar lounge, which has been now closed for a while). For the price we paid one could definitely get a lot more in today's market.

Reviews.Title: “Business as unusual”
Reviews.Author: GFK88
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel for the business traveler. Highly competent and well trained team of professionals, good rooms, fast internet, excellent restaurants. The Oysters at the Rib Room (steak house) are worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, amazing lift but hold on! Has everything you would expect from a 5* hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Longhurst10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending ATM 2011 and it's a great location and walkable if you can be bothered only about 1km. Great views of financial district and Burj Khalifa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: netdadou
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days during the new year's eve in the Jumeirah Emirates Towers hotel. The room are amazing with a beautiful view on the Burj Kalhifa. The service was wonderful, the access to the private beach a real advantage.Our roommate was so friendly and make our stay wonderful. We will comme back quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: JavedAhmed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Reached hotel past mid night. Check in was smooth and no issue was encountered. Room was good and spacious. However, I was surprised to see that there were no amenities available in the bath room such as comb, cotton buds, sewing kit etc which is normally available in all 4* and better hotels. Looks like the hotel is trying to save as much cost as possible. I don't expect it from $ 300 a night hotel. Breakfast was pretty good however I have yet to see a better breakfast than Le Meridian at Dubai Airport. Although metro station is quite close, there is a free car drop available to the station from hotel. The room had tea/coffee making facilities. Iron and the Board was also available within the room. Lobby has free wi fi access. Overall the hotel was good and I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: WebMarkMngr
Reviews.Content: During May we went to Dubai for The Hotel Show and we stayed at the Emirates towers for 4 nights. It was absolutely fantastic ! The hotel operates in very a professional way. All the staff are very well trained and very helpful. Based on our 25 years of experience in the hotel industry we found this hotel to be one of the best hotel we visited so far !

Reviews.Title: “Love the Ladies Floor!”
Reviews.Author: coolcaz
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I'd ever heard of that had a whole ladies-only floor, with all female staff and female-specific amenities, so I thought I'd give it a go... It was amazing! The rooms are a bit pink, but you get a yoga mat and yoga DVDs to use during your stay, the Chopard toiletries are lovely, and there's even a little fridge in the bathroom for your makeup! Such a shame I only stayed for one night... The hotel itself is very impressive, with glass lifts that give you a wonderful view as you whizz up through the hotel. The in-room wifi worked just fine, the pool was lovely, and they very kindly let me use the gym changing rooms after I'd had to check out but before my evening event. The little map of jogging routes was also really handy (it's in the bathroom cabinet). But the most impressive thing for me? FINALLY a Dubai hotel I can get to by public transport! I am pretty fed up of the necessary dependence on taxis to go anywhere, so it was fantastic to stay somewhere walking distance from a Metro station - it was so quick and easy to get there from the airport, even quite late at night. The hotel do offer a pick-up service from the Metro station, but it's so close I didn't see the point. The hotel is also walking distance to the DIFC, which is handy for most business travellers, and being joined to a mall is always good too (Starbucks!). I would totally stay here again next time I go to Dubai on business, mostly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality ME hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSN
Reviews.Content: love the molton brown in the bathroom big rooms free wifi breakfast is over priced and not the best part good that you can charge hotels from the designer shopping centre to your room lots of mixed clients which can be a bit unnerving pool area a little dated but gym changing is modern and excellent transfer from hotel is ridiculous at £50 compared to £7 in a cab slippers are a little odd great service with turndown

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away by This Stunning Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FoolishJumper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a two week trip to India and flew on Emirates who had a promotion that gave us two free nights in Dubai at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel. Not to pass up a free holiday, we took them up on the offer. I certainly didn't have over-the-top hopes, but I figured we'd be happy enough with the hotel. I was absolutely blown away by this hotel. From the second we walked in the door, we felt like VIPs. It was all the little details - fresh dates in the room, a bottle of red wine to drink at our pleasure, free cocktails in the sky bar, and the jump to provide service at every moment. The breakfast was also absolutely top notch. I figured this trip was just a chance to see Dubai (I had been for 2 weeks previously for work, but my wife hadn't), but the hotel really made the trip. I have no question that I'll book the Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel if I were to return to Dubai for a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “cannot beleive negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: graciepop123
Reviews.Content: I know i am late adding this review but after seeing all the negative i felt i had to add my review. My family stayed here over the new year, and due to my daughter having an illness we had to stay an extra week. All i can say is that every member of staff went out of their way to be helpful. The staff members at breakfast were great. The manager and manageress? could not do enough for us. If they read this we were the family that that kept adding a day at a time as we could not fly home. Also my daughter had with her a little brown bear to snuggle at night. One day the bear went missing, it just got coaught up with the sheets when the room was made up. We phoned house keeping and to cut a very long story short, Omaha? found the bear and my daughter was so happy. Please thank him again as im sure he will remember little brown bear. Some of the reviews feel as though they have stayed elsewhere. The staff worked so hard. the hotel runs shuttles to the beach hotels and to the malls. Thank you again for a great stay. One day the breakfast room was so busy we were allowed to have room service at no extra charge as our daughter was so hungry. That is what i call service.

Reviews.Title: “They do not cater to people with a fear of heights”
Reviews.Author: cntrave
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely modern hotel, but stay away if you have a fear of heights, Although I had requested multiple times to have a room on a very low floor, I was told on check-in that I had to stay on the 19th floor - the elevators are all glass and go up the inside walls with open views (panoramic as they describe them). There is an enclosed elevator that is extremely hard to get, as it is attached to the same call buttons as the glassed-in elevators. So, I am in the 2nd day of a week long stay totally petrified with no help from the front desk. Keep this in mind if you do not like heights.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hargravesg
Reviews.Content: This is the business hotel in Dubai. It is centrally located and is typical of most high end hotels in Dubai: expensive but with well appointed rooms and generally excellent service. I usually reserve a club room as the club lounge offers great food and beverages, dedicated staff and a reasonable view. While the pool is fine, this is not a hotel designed for holiday/vacation travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a quick business trip”
Reviews.Author: JPetch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times now and it has been perfect for all my needs each time. The rooms are large, clean, comfortable, airy and have great bathrooms. If you have a few moments the pool is nice too and has a very friendly bar outside. I usually try and catch a half hour of sun with a quick salad if I can. The breakfast is your usual large hotel style, could be better but perfectly adequate. I'm sick of omelette stations and odd tasting sausages to be honest so hardly this hotels fault. If you like being waited on this hotel is great too. I personally find it a bit annoying/uncomfortable but they are only doing what they are told I guess. Overall, nice hotel. Will stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: i spent two nights here recently. First time at this hotel though have vacationed several times before at Al Qasr, Jumeirah Beach, DAM etc with family. This was a business trip so the location was far better than the beach hotels and is perfect for business in Dubai. I was upgraded to a suite on arrival. A bit wasted on me as I didn't use the space that much - but the room was incredible - dining room ,kitchenette, big bedroom, big bathroom, sitting room etc etc, Lavish, tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean and great perks like free mini bar and suit pressing etc. Bed very very comforatble and bathroom was great - though shower cubicle a little cramped. Service at the hotel was brilliant - though if I was being over fussy - the service was over-fussy: 4 different people asking you for juice at reception, waitress coming back and asking 7-8 questions about lunch order, check in girl took 10 mins. But I am being pedantic - service is very very good and nothing is to much trouble. Food: breakfast as always in Jumeirah properties : vast and incredible quality. I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly for business - if you are with family go and stay in the Madinat or Jumeirah Beach, Same service and quality - better 'vibe' for families.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel for both Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Boris74
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Emirates Towers a number of times on business trips and will be back at the property again this week. When we were looking to come down to Dubai with the kids for the first time on a vacation, we originally looked through all the various options for the beach front properties. The prices were on average double what we were able to get at the Emirates Towers in the financial and business district. We took advantage of a weekend special rate for Club Premium (Executive Floor) room. We were upgraded upon arrival to one of the circular suites which gave us extra room and a great view of the city from 40+ floors up. The complimentary food and drink available in the Executive Lounge were first class as was the service provided by the staff. The evening buffet was generally enough that we did not need to pay to go out for dinner as well. If you are coming to Dubai to spend all your time lying on the beach, then this is not the property for you. But if, like us, you enjoy spending time exploring (the desert adventure safari is great as is walking round the old town) and shopping (the Dubai Mall is very close), with some beach time - this is a great alternative. The hotel provides complimentary beach access through other Jumeirah properties and provides a complimentary shuttle. While we enjoyed visiting other hotels such as the Madinat, they were busy and noisy, and we were glad to be able to return to the relative calm and first class service of the Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Good choise for both leisure and business”
Reviews.Author: Kritisk
Reviews.Content: I went for 4 nights with my husband, he was working and I enjoyed the beach at Madinat. We stayed at level 42. The people in the executivelounge did everything they could to help, best service ever :-) Rooms are big and spotles, Molton Brown almenities is very nice. The Rib room was closed, but we had a nice meal in the basement restaurant one night. A bit quiet, but nice food. Will stay here again if the purpose is not just holiday, if so we will stay at Madinat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: smitta
Reviews.Content: I had gone to Dubai for a business conference and taken my spouse along to combine it with a leisure trip. We stayed at Jumeirah Emirates Towers for 4 nights, it was an amazing experience, during the days when I was away for the conference my wife had ample of things to enjoy in the hotel, like the amazing spa and the pool. The hotel has a beautiful view of the skyline with Burj Khalifa only a few blocks away. It has a very nice bar on the top floor with a scenic Dubai view, they also offer you free tickets to the Wild Wadi water park and free shuttles to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hsm1208
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The service, for the most part, is impeccable, staff was courteous, helpful and friendly. There were a few times when I got a little frustrated, but it was more due to language barriers than from the staff lacking customer service ability. Room service was great, as was Mosaico for lunch. Never had a problem getting a cab. Concierge was always amazing- getting us dinner reservations and arranging us a car for both tours of Dubai and trips to Abu Dhabi and Khasab, Oman. I will definitely be staying at this hotel every time I come back to Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Livingwell_1_11
Reviews.Content: Great in everyway. Rooms, service, location, transport all excellent. I go back to this hotel eveytime I am in Dubai. Great value for money and I love the free tranfer to either 2 beach clubs. This hotel is my wife favourite also. You wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: George123R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. Must say here I expereinced the quickest check in I ever experienced at any hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. During my time the hotel was very busy but I could only see business people and no families with children. I personally will use the hotel again should i be in Dubai on business but will defenitely choose another hotel if i take my family on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel but good for tourists too”
Reviews.Author: nryan33
Reviews.Content: I forgot to write our review of here until we mentioned it a few days ago as the best breakfast we have ever had. We stayed here for two nights during Ramadam at a good rate and received a really nice room. The hotel is really nice but the best thing about it were the staff who were really nice and very helpful. They arranged a trip to the waterpark plus the sister Hotel Bur al Arab for us and greeted us with cool towels every time we arrived back. The pool was small but nice for a relaxing hour and the skyview bar is well worth a cocktail. Because of the new metro it is now accessible for tourists also. Would recommend this hotel and my compliments to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Always classic for business”
Reviews.Author: lajolla1
Reviews.Content: For business - Emirates Towers still has it. Though for more fun and if you enjoy walking, then the Address is it. Other favorites: One and Only, Jumeriahs' Al Qasr and Ritz, Hilton on dubai beach area is good location for walking on the beach and if you are visiting friends at JBR. (jumeriah Beach residences)

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and luxurious accommodation - paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Horse
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to this hotel. When we first went there back in 2003, we were blown away by the high standards of service. In latter years, standards dropped a little, but I'm pleased to report they're right back where they started and you'll find it hard to get better. We were met from our plane by the hotel car and were impressed to find that, though we arrived very early in the morning, they could take us straight to our room - and I mean straight - we didn't even stop to check in, a member of the hotel staff did that for us from our hotel room. It is hard to lift a finger here, staff call lifts for you, open and close doors, hail taxis and open and close every car door as well and there's always a "welcome back" to greet you as you reenter the hotel. It's the same level of service at the pool, with staff on hand to put towels on the sun beds, hand out complimentary iced water, cold towels and various other fruit snacks and drinks. For a few years now we have been disappointed by the hotel's so called "beach club" which was really very basic indeed (the original one was to die for!). They now offer complimentary beach facilities at two sister hotels with a hotel shuttle - we tried the "Madinat" and it offered a very high standard of service, a fantastic beach front and allowed us the flexibility to charge drinks to our hotel room. Just like the old days! We stayed in a premier room - which is basically a suite with lounge and bedroom. It also gives you access to the club room which offers 3 light meals a day, afternoon tea and complimentary drinks. Again, we were becoming dissatisfied with the atmosphere here, because they had previously offered this facility to a wider range of rooms which could make it crowded at times, but now it is back to the peaceful haven we knew and loved from earlier times. Staff are quick to remember your names and your favourite drinks - one member of staff even remembered us from our visit the previous year! This is primarily a business hotel - and that is why we like it so much. It gives us a much quieter holiday than at the beach, which is much more family oriented, and yet you can still get to the beach but return to peace and quiet. My husband has also stayed here on business and finds the central location, the free wifi and the huge work desks in the bedroom a real blessing. Despite being business oriented, this did not stop housekeeping from fashioning a pair of hotel towels into the cutest white swans and covering them with rose petals for us at the entrance to our room. I am quite sure they don't do this for their business clients (at least I hope not!), so it really was a personal touch and quite a surprise for us, given that my husband and I are decidedly not honeymooners! One small gripe - prostitution is definitely on the increase since we started staying in Dubai and, for the first time ever, I found myself sharing a hotel lift with a prostitute and her client one evening. I have lived enough of a sheltered life to be quite embarrassed by this. The prostitute herself was very discretely dressed and well-behaved in the lift, but unfortunately her English male client was not! I'm not sure there is much hotel staff can do about this, but it's not an experience I want to repeat. All in all though, room, beach, service - this hotel is HUGELY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful in the business area”
Reviews.Author: chewietobbacca
Reviews.Content: From the get go, it is clear the Jumeirah Emirates Towers is geared for business travelers. The majority of those staying there are of the business type, and you'll be a fair distance from the beach areas. That being said, they have a free shuttle to the Jumeirah Beach and Wild Wadi waterpark. Also, its location is quite good if you want to go shopping at Dubai Mall (a 5-10 minute taxi ride - 10 dirhams), the Burj Khalifa, or if you want to visit the other side of the Creek. It's a 10-15 minute ride to the airport when there isn't traffic. The facilities are quite beautiful - the room was immaculate and very big, and the breakfast was delicious as well. If you're here for leisure, don't let the business atmosphere discourage you - it's quite suitable for visitors as well, just expect the atmosphere to be more business like. One thing to note is that during rush hour, it might be hard to get a cab to come up here, since the JET is a bit away from the typical resort locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Betna
Reviews.Content: staying in Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel was a great experience and i loved very minute of it, we booked our trip through [---] and we got the best deal, we stayed there for 3 days and 4 nights and had a lovely time staying there, with large and airy rooms, good service, neatness and concern for hygiene which not many people pay attention too and last of all good beds, our tour operator picked us from the hotel each morning to take us new places and those days were too good, if i go back to dubai, i would certainly stay in Jumeirah Emirates Towers Hotel again due to the cordial serivce and good rooms they offer!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, impeccable service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Nellsh75
Reviews.Content: Emirates Towers in Dubai's Jumaira neighborhood is likely the best upper-end business hotel in Dubai, and works well for families also. Rooms are excellent (Club Floor highly recommended), regular Mall shuttle is convenient. Service is excellent from doormen to housekeeping to checkout. Pool is lovely and classy. Everything was clean and well-placed. Bathrooms elegant and extremely clean. Only complaint: some of the [free] Exec Lounge cold items at dinner didn't seem cold enough, didn't look or smell appetizing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel..for business but also for leisure”
Reviews.Author: EuDiMu
Reviews.Content: I would like to strongly recommend the Emirates Towers Hotel. If you're a tourist looking for beach and sun, maybe Jumeirah Beach or Marina are a better option. But if you want be in downtown area close to the Dubai Mall and Burj khalifa this is a great option. Client attendancy is quite slow as usual in all Dubai...it took almost 20 minutes to get the check in.. We stayed at Chopard Floor... The room was huge, with a view on Sheikh Zayed Rd. All the bath products were Chopard and in the bathroom there is also a small frigde for your face lotion.. The elevator is amazing: all in glass and offers an amazing view of the Sheikh Zayed Rd. One point to highlight is the fabulous breakfast...delicious and excellent value for money... I would definitely say they have the most delicious pastries of all the Gulf....

Reviews.Title: “High rise business in the centre of dubai”
Reviews.Author: Waldea
Reviews.Content: Top location hotel with large rooms and good views from the high floors. Service good, but struggled to get a room early after overnight flight, even though rooms were available. Lots of choice at breakfast, but no toast ! Personally, prefer The Address downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Wish it was by the beach though”
Reviews.Author: funkychic
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and the amazing service. The spa etc wow...the glass lifts (not for the vertigo inclined). Only wished it was nearer the beach and malls..but taxis are cheap

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: davidsoj
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a number of times now and it never disappoints. Lovely facilities, amazing service and everything on hand. Although we were staying at the towers, you can get a day pass to use the facilities at the jumeirah beach hotel, wild wadi or the madinat, get the shuttle bus which is free and leaves every couple of hours. Free internet for guest for 15 minutes in the business centre.
